title: Quantum computing is already here, sort of
description: Brief letters: Semiconductors | Say it with flowers, two days before | Trouble getting up | KGB keeping busy, despite its demise

title: Google unveils ‘mindboggling’ quantum computing chip
description: Chip takes minutes to complete tasks that would otherwise take 10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 years

title: Microsoft unveils chip it says could bring quantum computing within years
description: Chip is powered by world’s first topoconductor, which can create new state of matter that is not solid, liquid or gas

title: From AI to quantum computing: a postgrad degree for the next generation of digital leaders
description: Alliance Manchester Business School is launching an MSc in Digital Transformation, to meet the growing demand from employers for these skills

title: New powder that captures carbon could be ‘quantum leap’ for industry
description: A ‘covalent organic framework’ can be used to capture carbon to store it or convert it for industrial use

title: IBM unveils new quantum computing chip to ‘explore new frontiers of science’
description: Computer and AI giant rolls out machine using ‘Heron’ chips using subatomic particles instead of ones and zeros

title: Tinashe: Quantum Baby review – playful, featherlight 90s-trap fusion
description: The US R&B outlier’s viral summer anthem Nasty is the standout track on a generally more muted genre-blending album

title: Quantum Witch: where religious cults collide with 80s Spectrum games
description: This queer emancipation story is set in a cosy pixellated art world but all is not what it seems. You’ll tend your flock, pick some flowers – and also have to dethrone God

title: Reeves announces £8bn UK investment by Amazon’s cloud computing arm
description: Chancellor says move will create as many as 14,000 jobs at firm’s datacentres and in a range of other industries

title: Quantum physicist Michelle Simmons awarded PM’s top science prize for computing work
description: 2018 Australian of the year recognised for work on super-fast technology in field of atomic electronics
